traceability.evidence: 1) src/config-loader.js implements loadConfigFile() reading .dry-aged-deps.json, validating schema (minAge, severity, prod, dev, format), enforcing CLI>config>defaults precedence and exiting with code 2 on JSON parse errors, unknown keys or invalid values. 2) src/cli-options.js calls loadConfigFile() and then merges config values with CLI flags (parseFormatFlag, parseMinAgeFlag, parseSeverityFlag, etc.) with correct precedence. 3) bin/dry-aged-deps.js supports --config-file= and reports missing custom files with exit code 2 and clear message. 4) test/cli.config-file.test.js (7 tests) covers: applying defaults from config, CLI flags overriding config, invalid JSON, unknown keys, out-of-range minAge, custom config filename, and missing custom file. 5) README.md documents --config-file flag, shows example .dry-aged-deps.json schema and usage. All relevant Vitest tests pass (npm test).
traceability.notes: The 010.0-DEV-CONFIG-FILE-SUPPORT story is fully implemented: the tool reads an optional JSON config in the project root (or a custom path), validates it, merges it with CLI flags using the correct precedence, handles all error cases, and is documented and tested end-to-end.
